job_title: Patient Financial Advocate in Mountain Home, AR
pros: This was a good opportunity for me to learn how hospital billing and patient financials work. I never worked in a hospital setting before. I liked learning that hospitals have a bunch of programs to help patients who struggle with paying their bills and don't just send them onto collections. That meant a lot to me to find out since the majority of this town are elderly.
cons: Some of the issues that I did have was not really with the company I worked with but the patients. When I say this I don't mean that I had issues with the patients themselves. I was assigned a certain amount of the alphabet as my patients that I was to work with. The problem with being in a small town, is that most of the patients get used to a certain person and don't necessarily want to work with someone they don't know.

review_title: Good place to work, but needs improvement
job_title: CNA in Mountain Home, AR
pros:
- Great staff, both nursing and non
- Great patients and families
- Good starting pay for a new CNA
- Good employee training
cons:
- Lack of interdepartmental communication
- Short staffed at times
- Hours: If you need consistent hours, be sure to apply for a full-time position. As a PRN employee, I typically worked 6 hours/day, but some days I worked 10+ or none at all. It's a blessing at times, but can be very frustrating.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cotter, AR
pros: Good coworkers and good pay.
cons: Kept away from Hospital and Human Resource and know one ever goes there to see what is going on. Very high turn over rate. that is never been looked into. Supervisor does not want coworkers to talk because she is paranoid that someone is out to get her. You can do a great job but she will find something to write you up for so you can never transfer out of the department.

review_title: Revenue first, patient care and employee satisfaction somewhere below...
